remarks: Any finite product containing a zero term is itself zero.  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Apr-2020.)
statement:
fprodeq0g.kph $e |- F/ k ph $.
fprodeq0g.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. Fin ) $.
fprodeq0g.b $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. A ) -> B e. CC ) $.
fprodeq0g.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. A ) $.
fprodeq0g.b0 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k = C ) -> B = 0 ) $.
fprodeq0g $p |- ( ph -> prod_ k e. A B = 0 ) $.
$d A k $.
$d C k $.
